content:
Investments Stocks Asked by AnonymousAsked on 15 May 2019Many companies have delist or is delisting soon.

Yet recent IPO are quite lousy.  Is Singapore/sgx losing its status as financial hub? What are some ways to attract company to IPO here?There are more exits than good entrants, this will just make SG lose its competitiveness and attractiveness won't it?1 answerAnswerBump1
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Gabriel Tham, Kenichi Tag Team Member at Tag TeamLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 15 May 2019Deregulate will be good. SGX everything also query, move abit only query.One must understand that the markets will have winners and losers. SG tries very hard to protect people from losing. So many query, trading halt and investors only like yields and REITs.Look at HK markets, alot more HUGE scandals but there is more vibrancy in volume and trading. Because people need to feel they can win big and on the other end sadly someone will lose big too. In SG, just 1 hyflux loss and then all go Hong Lim to protest and make noise.0 comments1
